sg.yeefan.searchenginewrapper
Class ResultsXMLReader

java.lang.Object
  sg.yeefan.searchenginewrapper.ResultsXMLReader

public class ResultsXMLReader
extends java.lang.Object

Reader for reading search engine results from a XML file. The input XML file should contain zero or more <results> elements anywhere in the XML file, each representing a set of search engine results. It is mandatory to call the close() method after all the search engine results have been read.

This reader must be able to read in XML files that contains zero or more root elements, but are otherwise well-formed. XML files produced by the ResultsXMLReader class or the the legacy SearchEngineResultsXML class must be readable by this reader.

Implementatation notes: This implementation uses Streaming API for XML (StAX) to read in the XML file. The input character stream is manipulated on the fly to insert a root element encapsulating the whole XML file before passing it to the XML parser.

Author:
Tan Yee Fan

Method Detail

getEncoding

public java.lang.String getEncoding()
Returns the file encoding of this XML reader. If the constructor ResultsXMLReader(Reader) is called, then null is returned.

readResults

public SearchEngineResults readResults()
                                throws java.io.IOException
Reads a set of search engine results. If no more result sets are available, null is returned.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - If an error occurred when reading the XML file.

readResultsList

public java.util.List<SearchEngineResults> readResultsList()
                                                    throws java.io.IOException
Reads a list containing all sets of search engine results.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - If an error occurred when reading the XML file.
